attributes.comment:
Anything that will help modernize USCIS is badly needed, and will affect in a
very real way the lives of those who are impacted by the delays in processing. I
know that for my pending case before USCIS, I would have been very happy to pay
extra to have the process expedited.

For those of us, like myself, who follow immigration rules to the letter of the
law, the process and lack of communication about any progress during processing
is very frustrating. I understand that there are likely many applicants who are
attempting to illegally gain entry into the US, but with the proper staffing
resources, USCIS should and can provide the level of service that honest,
hard-working citizens like myself deserve.

Lives hang in the balance for all of us with legitimate pending applications for
immigration to the US. The hardship created for those of us separated from our
spouses by the very lengthy processing times is beyond unbearable.

Also, it should be noted that the 6-months being reported by the USCIS website,
is not at all accurate. I am not sure how the reporting to senior USCIS
management is being rigged to report a 6-month average turn-around (I-130's),
but this estimate shown on the USCIS website simply does not reflect the
real-world situation.

Respectfully,

Tom Siechert
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Tom Siechert
